result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Amy. 
Called: 8:56 a.m. 
INCLUDES 19CF59, 22CF971
State appears by ADA Lacey Coonen. 
Defendant appears in custody from MCJ, pro se. 

Date and time set for motion hearing for bond modification.  
COURT discusses speedy trial/indigency hearing requests by defendant; recites history. 
COURT notes arraignment needs to be done in 22CF971.
Defendant states he does not qualify for SPD representation, just filed paperwork yesterday from jail. 
COURT grants speedy trial request. 

COURT will await indigency paperwork.  
COURT sets IH 9/08/22 at 9:30 a.m. 

COURT addresses motion for bond modification (Doc 8).   
Defendant makes statement re: treatment. 
ADA Coonen makes objections to bond modification; advises agent can contact her directly for any treatment issues. 

COURT holds open bond modification and will review bond modification on 9/08/22.

Adj:  9:10 a.m.
Defendant's Demand for Speedy Trial and Indigency Hearing- stj

INCLUDES 19CF59 & 22CF971: No contact with victim(s): Walmart and co-defendant(s): C.Y. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Police escort to retrieve personal property from the residence. Third party child exchange through the Family Resource Center. No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents. Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol/controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed. Shall not drive a motor vehicle without valid driver's license. Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (4) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

Clerk: Amanda.
Case called at 3:10 pm.
INCLUDES: 19CF59 & 22CF971. 
State appears by ADA Hannah Boeck.  Deft appears from MCJ w/ Atty Adam Fontana. 
Date and Time set for IA and Warrant Quash; VRCW. 

COURT QUASHES WARRANT. 

Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 

Prelim Time Limits Preserved. 
PO HOLD. 

COURT ORDERS: $500 cash bond - CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s):  Walmart and co-deft(s): C.Y. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
- Police escort to retrieve personal property from the residence. 
- 3rd party child exchange through the family resource center. 
- No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores, or Beer Tents. 
- Absolute sobriety from, and no possession of alcohol. 
- Absolute sobriety from, and no possession of controlled substances, except prescriptions taken as prescribed. 
- No driving without a valid license. 
- ATTIC - contact within 5 business days / before next hearing. 
- No possession or use of dangerous weapons. 
- Prints and photograph. 
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 4 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.
